components/badge.title: Badge
components/badge.description: Badges can be used to highlight new or unread items, Limited usage is recommended, mainly for displaying numeric values in combination with other data to provide context. Do not use in place of labels, or any other similar element.

components/block-list.title: Block List
components/block-list.description: A block list is a simple way to present lists of information and supports different markup schemes depending on what is most appropriate for the data. Markup can be based around ul, ol, div or link elements.

components/breadcrumb.title: Breadcrumb
components/breadcrumb.description: A basic helper to render a list of breadcrumb links. A view should set a breadcrumbs object which will then be rendered by the base template.

components/button.title: Button
components/button.description: Pulsar buttons are an all purpose user interface element allowing users to perform actions, submit forms and progress through transactions.

components/button-group.title: Button group
components/button-group.description: Group a collection of related buttons together on a single line. Great for creating toolbars.

components/card.title: Card
components/card.description: Cards are a flexible container for standout content with a range of configurable options for headers and footers, images and calls to action.

components/datatable.title: Datatable
components/datatable.description: Datatables use the datatables.net plugin to provide a nice amount of functionality to your data. Pulsar’s configuration includes plugins to make them responsive. Where possible you should refer to the official [datatable documentation(https://datatables.net/).

components/dropdown-button.title: Dropdown button
components/dropdown-button.description: Display a contextual list of actions presented as a drop down list when the button is pressed.

components/dropzone.title: Dropzone
components/dropzone.description: The DropZone is a component that can create a pre-formatted area for users to drag files, it can also be used to convert an existing HTML element into a droppable area.

components/flash-message.title: Flash Message
components/flash-message.description: Flash messages alert the user when things happen, this may be to confirm that something has occurred successfully, like saving a document, or when something goes wrong. Flash messages may also highlight problems with the system that the user may need to know about, like a loss of network connectivity which is preventing auto-save.

components/icon.title: Icon
components/icon.description: Help visually distinguish and provide extra meaning to certain items or actions. You can pass an icon name or mime type to generate the appropriate icon.

components/label.title: Label
components/label.description: Provide extra contextual meaning to things, like stateful information.

components/link.title: Link
components/link.description: Creates a simple HTML link, often used inside other helpers.

components/link-list.title: Link List
components/link-list.description: A specialised helper to create lists of links without the need to manually call multiple link helpers. Markup can be based around ul (default), ol, div or link elements.

components/list.title: List
components/list.description: Pass an array of items and have them rendered as a simple unordered or ordered list, this is particularly useful when chained with other helpers.

components/loading-spinner.title: Loading spinner
components/loading-spinner.description: Give feedback to the user that something is happening or that information is being retrieved from the server.

components/media.title: Media
components/media.description: The media object is, typically, an image on the left with descriptive content on the right. They can be used standalone, stacked, or as part of other components like block lists.

components/metadata.title: Metadata
components/metadata.description: Provides a simple way to mark up key/value information provided by a Twig hash or JSON object.

components/modal.title: Modal
components/modal.description: Modal windows, also known as dialogs or overlays are UI components that sit on top of the current page, usually with a semi-transparent layer behind them to separate them from the main page.

components/pagination.title: Pagination
components/pagination.description: Provide a control for users to navigate through 'pages' of content and to get a sense of how many records may be available.

components/panel.title: Panel
components/panel.description: Display important information in a prominent container.

components/progress-bar.title: Progress Bar
components/progress-bar.description: Provide up-to-date feedback on the progress of a workflow or action with simple progress bars.

components/progress-list.title: Progress List
components/progress-list.description: Show a user’s position in a multi-step workflow.

components/remove-button.title: Remove Button
components/remove-button.description: Used by other helpers to add consistenly styled button to indicate an object can be removed.

components/status.title: Status
components/status.description: Displays a small visual indication of state; helpful when used within table cells or piano list keys to avoid the need for a user to check many items individually to determine their state.

components/table.title: Table
components/table.description: Tables (and the more interactive datatables) allow the presentation of tabular data. For the table layout pattern, you’ll likely want to use a datatable instead of a basic table.

components/tooltips.title: Tooltips
components/tooltips.description: Add floating labels that appear on hover or focus to provide supplemental or descriptive information.

doc1.title: Style Guide
doc1.description: You can write content using GitHub-flavored Markdown syntax.

doc2.description: This is a link to another document. This is a link to an external page.

forms/button-group.title: Button Group
forms/button-group.description: Group a series of related buttons together on a single line. Great for creating toolbars.

forms/checkbox.title: Checkbox
forms/checkbox.description: Generates a checkbox input field. There are various different options available to control the position of the checkbox and labels.

forms/choice.title: Choice
forms/choice.description: Displayed as a question with multiple answers, each of which has its own label and can allow either singular (checkboxes) or multiple (radios) choice.

forms/color.title: Color
forms/color.description: Choose colours using an interactive colour palette.

forms/compound.title: Compound
forms/compound.description: The compound helper allows you to build a form group using multiple separate inputs with a single common label, and render those in a screenreader-friendly way.

forms/content.title: Content
forms/content.description: Generates a paragraph of text where an input would normally be positioned within a form while still allowing a regular form label to illustrate it.

forms/creating-a-form.title: Creating a form
forms/creating-a-form.description: A form is a collection of inputs that allow users to create and edit 'things' within the Jadu platform. Pulsar forms provide consistent styling as well as sensible defaults so that developers can quickly compose useful, accessible forms.

forms/date.title: Date
forms/date.description: The date helper now has the ability to opt-in to use a WCAG 2.1 compliant date datepicker. Where possible, this should be used over the default date picker (Pikaday).

forms/error-summary.title: Error summary
forms/error-summary.description: When form validation fails it is important to display a list of all errors near the top of the page and link to the affected fields. This summary is especially important for people using assistive technology to make sure their tools announce the presence of errors as soon as possible.

forms/fieldset.title: Fieldset
forms/fieldset.description: Fieldsets group related controls into logical sections.

forms/hidden.title: Hidden
forms/hidden.description: Generates a hidden text input which can be used to store non user-editable data.

forms/radio.title: Radio
forms/radio.description: Generates a radio input field. There are various different options available to control the position of the radio and labels.

forms/repeater.title: Repeater
forms/repeater.description: Create a repeatable set of form fields that can be added and removed.

forms/select2.title: Select2
forms/select2.description: The select2 helper is like a regular select but adds extra functionality such as quicksearch, and the ability to add custom markup to your results.

forms/text.title: Text
forms/text.description: Generates a text input field allowing users to input data, with a variety of options for additional help and guidance information.

forms/textarea.title: Textarea
forms/textarea.description: Generates a textarea with options to control the number of rows (the height) of the element as well as additional help and guidance information.

forms/time.title: Time
forms/time.description: Generate a text input field which will show a time picker overlay when focused.

forms/toggle-switch.title: Toggle switch
forms/toggle-switch.description: An alternative presentation for a checkbox, providing a more obvious visual indication of the on/off state.

guides/accessibility.title: Accessibility
guides/accessibility.description: The Pulsar Design System provides accessible components, layouts and recommended patterns which serve as a foundation for your application development.

guides/browsers.title: Browsers and devices
guides/browsers.description: We automatically gather browser information from Continuum platform users to inform which browsers we design and test for.

guides/colour-and-state.title: Colour and state
guides/colour-and-state.description: Pulsar uses a standardised colour palette which incorporates the colours defined in Jadu’s brand styleguide.

guides/design-tokens.title: Design tokens
guides/design-tokens.description: Design tokens store static values for a variety of design attributes. Use them in place of hardcoded values to ensure consistency in your user interface.

guides/disabling-elements.title: Disabling elements
guides/disabling-elements.description: Disabling an element requires adding the appropriate attribute for the browser and any assistive device to recognise the element as being disabled, as well as a class to toggle the disabled styling of a given element.

guides/error-messages.title: Error messages
guides/error-messages.description: Error messages are a critical user interface component, they must explain to people that something unexpected has occurred and how to resolve it.

guides/getting-started.title: Getting started
guides/getting-started.description: As a Jadu designer or developer, you’re probably working on one or more of the Jadu platform products (CMS, XFP and CXM). Pulsar is already installed and available for you to use in your user-interface. There are, however, some important things to know.

guides/helpers.title: Helpers
guides/helpers.description: Pulsar helpers are a quick way to include and configure components into your user interface, there are Twig and React variants available, depending on your UI environment.

mdx.title: Powered by MDX
mdx.description: You can write JSX and use React components within your Markdown thanks to MDX.

patterns/actionsbar.title: Actions Bar
patterns/actionsbar.description: The actions bar is a component within a tab which is split into left/right sides and contains important controls for a given user interface.

patterns/common-form.title: Common Form
patterns/common-form.description: The common form user interface pattern is the most frequent pattern used to display a form which can be used to create a new Thing or edit an existing Thing.

patterns/common-list.title: Common List
patterns/common-list.description: The common list user interface pattern is the most frequent pattern used to display a paginated collection of ‘Things’, with related actions which can manipulate that collection.

patterns/disabled-ui.title: Disabled UI
patterns/disabled-ui.description: The Disabled UI pattern allows you to prevent the user from interacting with parts of a UI. This can be useful when an external action needs completing before the UI can be used. A message should be shown advising the user what action needs to be taken.

patterns/filter-bar.title: Filter Bar
patterns/filter-bar.description: The filter bar pattern allows you to build up a list of filters to be applied to a UI. Commonly used to filter tabular data as an alternative to displaying a potentially large form.

patterns/integrations.title: Integrations
patterns/integrations.description: Integrations are a highly technical feature, often linking together separate systems and software using technical terminology like port numbers, timeouts and access tokens. Great care should be taken to design the integration to help the user understand what information they must supply and where they can find it.

patterns/masterswitch.title: Masterswitch
patterns/masterswitch.description: The masterswitch pattern allows you to enable and disable a larger UI with a single control. Commonly used in ‘settings’ interfaces it provides an easy to understand on/off switch for users.

patterns/no-results.title: No results
patterns/no-results.description: When an interface needs to list items you should provide a helpful fallback message for when no results are found. If the user has the relevant permissions to create or add one of these items, you should provide a call to action to help them along their way.

patterns/piano.title: Piano
patterns/piano.description: The piano pattern allows you to switch between different panels of content within the same UI. Commonly used in integration and messages UIs.

patterns/rules.title: Rules
patterns/rules.description: The Rules pattern allows users to build up a conditional logic statement in a visual way.

patterns/table-detail.title: Table Detail
patterns/table-detail.description: The table detail pattern allows a user to view additional information relevant to a row whilst staying in context.
